paper.title: Concordance-based predictive measures in regression models for discrete responses
paper.abstract: Dependence measures are often used in practice in order to assess the quality of a regression model. This is for instance the case with Kendall's tau and other association coefficients based on concordance probabilities. However, in case the response variable is discrete, correlation indices are often bounded and restricted to a sub-interval of . Hence, in this context, small positive values of Kendall's tau may actually support goodness of prediction when getting close to its highest attainable value. In this paper, we derive the best-possible upper bounds for Kendall's tau when the response variable is discrete. Two cases are considered, depending on whether the score is continuous or discrete. Also, we illustrate the obtained upper bounds on a motor third-party liability insurance portfolio.

domain_result.justification: 该论文主要研究离散响应回归模型中的一致性预测度量，虽然提到了在汽车第三方责任保险组合中的应用，但并未明确指出其核心技术应用于衍生品定价、金融风险管理或投资组合管理中的任何一个领域。
